item.title: Will the Winklevoss ETF Ever Happen? - Bitcoinist.net
item.description:
Will the Winklevoss ETF Ever Happen? - Bitcoinist.net

It's been three years since the Winklevoss twins announced their intention to release a bitcoin ETF to investors. Since then, they've battled with regulators and watched as others created and released similar products. Now, we're again hearing that the Winklevoss ETF will "soon" be released.

item.title: Ripple CTO Says Blockchain Is a Complex Technology Than Interledger
item.description:
Ripple CTO Says Blockchain Is a Complex Technology Than Interledger

In his new piece on Medium, Ripple CTO Stefan Thomas has explained why he thinks blockchain is a complex technology when compared with the Interledger Protocol. In his recent post, he said: Blockchains are a pain to work with. Everyone who has done it knows what I'm talking about.

item.title: After $65 million hack, questions of whether Bitcoin can be safe
item.description:
After $65 million hack, questions of whether Bitcoin can be safe

It seemed bitcoin exchange Bitfinex was doing all the right things. In the end, that didn't stop hackers from stealing $65 million. The latest in a long list of attacks on the digital currency since its birth in 2009 has been particularly vexing for the bitcoin community.

item.title: Bitcoin Tech Bootcamp & Milan Conference Vie for Tech Talent
item.description:
Bitcoin Tech Bootcamp & Milan Conference Vie for Tech Talent

A joint Bitcoin Bootcamp featuring teaching from 21 Inc and BitGo will offer just 15 atendees a "comprehensive" technical introduction to Bitcoin October 8-9. Also read: Bitcoin.com's 'Blockchain: Money' Conference is Coming to London The "accelerated 2-day workshop" will be held in Palo Alto, California and focus primarily on exploring the inner workings of Bitcoin and the Blockchain.

item.title: Why the Dream of The DAO Lives On - CoinDesk
item.description:
Why the Dream of The DAO Lives On - CoinDesk

There was a palpable distance onstage as discussion turned to The DAO. At this week's Blockchain NY conference, the founder of a startup that forked the ethereum blockchain to build its infrastructure and the co-creator of the decentralized application network itself sat as far from each other as they could while debating the now-infamous project.

item.title: Department of Homeland Security Awards Blockchain Tech Development Grants for Identity Management and Privacy Protection
item.description:
Department of Homeland Security Awards Blockchain Tech Development Grants for Identity Management and Privacy Protection

In May, Bitcoin Magazine reported that both the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) of the U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) and NATO have requested proposals for the development of military-related apps built on blockchain technology.

item.title: KeepKey Includes ShapeShift Support to Enable Trading over Hardware Wallet - NEWSBTC
item.description:
KeepKey Includes ShapeShift Support to Enable Trading over Hardware Wallet - NEWSBTC

KeepKey, the cryptocurrency hardware wallet company has partnered with ShapeShift to allow crypto-crypto trade on its devices. Read more... KeepKey, the hardware cryptocurrency wallet provider has announced the integration of ShapeShift. This integration will enable the company's hardware wallet users to swap their digital currency assets from within the device itself.

item.title: Betchain - A Professional Bitcoin Online Casino - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Betchain - A Professional Bitcoin Online Casino - NEWSBTC

BetChain is a professional online Bitcoin Casino that was established in 2014. Betchain is a licensed and regulated online casino that offers a wide range of games. From roulette to slots, baccarat, scratch cards, and even horse racing, you are unlikely to run out of options.

item.title: Razormind to Launch DeOS To Protect Your Privacy As Rival Ethereum Fades
item.description:
Razormind to Launch DeOS To Protect Your Privacy As Rival Ethereum Fades

Belfast, Northern Ireland, August 18, 2016 UK company Razormind announced today that its Decentralised Operating System (DeOS) will be open to the public on 10 October. DeOS is the first global public operating system powered by state of the art blockchain technology. DeOS enables public records of ownership and identity and comes complete with decentralized storage.

item.title: ELI49: Why is one single person able to change the bitcoin.org website and NOBODY ELSE even knows what tf this is all about? * /r/Bitcoin
item.description:
ELI49: Why is one single person able to change the bitcoin.org website and NOBODY ELSE even knows what tf this is all about? * /r/Bitcoin

EDIT: To be clear: I'm not worried because one person did it, I'm worried because NOBODY ELSE seemed to know about it.
